description: The user asks for a quick FAQ about exporting data to CSV for AcmeAnalytics v2. The assistant uses the FAQMaster AI toolset to fetch the relevant manual, extract the export section, embed and query it, summarize the findings, generate a concise Q&A pair, update the public FAQ page, and finally presents the answer to the user.

messages.content: You are FAQMaster AI, an agentic LLM that automatically creates up‑to‑date FAQ entries by ingesting product manuals, support tickets, and community forum posts. Use the provided tools to locate relevant content, summarize it, generate question‑answer pairs, and push the result to the product's help site.
I need a quick FAQ for “How to export data to CSV?” for AcmeAnalytics v2.
Let me gather the latest export instructions and create a concise FAQ for you.

chunks: Exporting data to CSV is performed via the File → Export → CSV option. First, open the dataset you wish to export. Then click the Export button, choose CSV as the format, optionally select the delimiter (comma is default), and click Save. The system will generate a CSV file containing all visible columns and rows. If the dataset is larger than 10,000 rows, the export runs as a background job and you receive an email with a download link once it finishes. Errors may occur if the dataset contains unsupported data types; in that case, convert those fields to text before exporting.

source_summaries: To export data to CSV in AcmeAnalytics v2, open the dataset, go to File → Export → CSV, choose CSV format, set delimiter if needed, and click Save. The system creates a CSV file with all visible columns and rows. For datasets >10,000 rows, the export runs in the background and you receive an email with a download link. Convert any unsupported data types to text before exporting to avoid errors.

arguments.faq_content:
# Exporting data to CSV

**Q:** How do I export data to CSV?

**A:** Open the dataset you want to export, select **File → Export → CSV**, choose CSV as the format, optionally set a delimiter (comma by default), and click **Save**. A CSV file containing all visible columns and rows will be generated. For large datasets (more than 10,000 rows), the export runs as a background job and you’ll receive an email with a download link when it’s ready. If the export fails, ensure any unsupported data types are converted to text before exporting.

✅ I’ve created a quick FAQ for you:

**Q:** How do I export data to CSV?

**A:** Open the dataset you want to export, select **File → Export → CSV**, choose CSV as the format, optionally set a delimiter (comma is default), and click **Save**. A CSV file containing all visible columns and rows will be generated. If the dataset is larger than 10,000 rows, the export runs as a background job and you’ll receive an email with a download link when it’s ready. Make sure any unsupported data types are converted to text before exporting to avoid errors.

The FAQ has also been published to the AcmeAnalytics v2 help site.
